facts.title: Silence in Space
facts.text: There is no atmosphere in space, which means that sound has no medium to travel through to be heard. It's completely silent.

facts.title: A Day on Venus
facts.text: A single day on Venus is longer than its entire year. It rotates so slowly that it takes 243 Earth days to spin once, but only 225 Earth days to orbit the Sun.

facts.title: Neutron Stars
facts.text: Neutron stars are the collapsed cores of massive stars. They are so dense that a single spoonful would weigh about 6 billion tons.

facts.title: The Smell of Space
facts.text: Astronauts report that space has a distinct smell of seared steak, hot metal, and welding fumes, likely from dying stars.

facts.title: Cosmic Water Cloud
facts.text: Astronomers found a massive water vapor cloud floating in space that holds 140 trillion times the mass of water in Earth's oceans.

facts.title: Countless Stars
facts.text: There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on all the beaches on Earth. That's at least a billion trillion!

facts.title: Fastest Planet
facts.text: Mercury orbits the Sun in just 88 Earth days, making its year the shortest in our solar system. You'd have a birthday every three months!

facts.title: Solar System's Volcano
facts.text: The largest volcano in the solar system is Olympus Mons on Mars. It's a shield volcano that's about three times taller than Mount Everest.

facts.title: Gas Giants
facts.text: You can't stand on Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, or Neptune because they are 'gas giants' and don't have a solid surface.

facts.title: A Diamond Star
facts.text: Astronomers found a star that is a massive diamond! It's a crystallized white dwarf named Lucy, after a famous Beatles song.

facts.title: Galaxy Collision
facts.text: Our Milky Way galaxy is on a collision course with the Andromeda galaxy. Don't worry, it won't happen for another 4.5 billion years!

facts.title: The Drifting Moon
facts.text: The Moon is slowly drifting away from Earth at a rate of about 1.5 inches (3.8 cm) per year. Millions of years ago, it was much closer!

facts.title: The Sun's Dominance
facts.text: Our Sun is so massive that it accounts for 99.86% of the total mass of our entire solar system. All the planets are just leftovers!

facts.title: A Year on Neptune
facts.text: One year on Neptune lasts for 165 Earth years. Since its discovery in 1846, it has only completed one full orbit around the sun.

facts.title: The Mysterious Planet Nine
facts.text: Scientists have found evidence of a giant, undiscovered planet orbiting far beyond Neptune. They call it 'Planet Nine', and the hunt to find it is on!
